name: Disgaea D2: A Brighter Darkness
summary: Disgaea D2: A Brighter Darkness is a tactical RPG in the Disgaea series. The game is a sequel to 2003's Disgaea: Hour of Darkness for the PlayStation 2, where the respective main characters of that game will again be the focus. Gameplay in Disgaea D2 remains the same as other core Disgaea games in the series. Monster Mounting is a new feature that replaces Magichange from Disgaea 3 and Disgaea 4. Characters can also build relationships with each other and their compatibility is determined by a heart scale of 1 to 5. Another feature is the Cheat Shop, which allows the player to modify certain attributes such as lowering the gain rate of something like experience, to raise the gain rate of something else, like Hell.

esrb.synopsis: This is a strategy role-playing game in which players control a group of characters as they try to maintain order in the Netherworld. From an overheard perspective, players move small characters around a grid in order to battle monsters and human-like characters in turn-based combat. Attacks are depicted with light effects, slashing sounds, and cries of pain; more elaborate attacks are depicted with short animated sequences. Some of the dialogue contains suggestive material (e.g., “Oh! Don't look! Big Brother, you're a pervert!” “I don't wanna sleep with some busty broad like you!” “I will engrave into that sexy body of yours just how terrifying I am!”). Some female characters are depicted with exaggerated breasts and/or wearing skimpy outfits that reveal large amounts of cleavage. During some sequences, players are able to give items such as “Hard Liquor” as bribes to senators; text reads “Drunk”/ “Drunken” in their descriptions. The words “sh*t,” “a*s,” and “b*tch” appear in the dialogue.

pegi.synopsis:
The content of this game is suitable for persons aged 12 years and over only.
It contains: Non realistic looking violence towards human characters - Sexual images and/or sexual innuendo - Mild bad language
